info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:41PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lewis and Clark and western Teton Counties through 1245 AM MDT... At 1141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 25 miles west of Augusta, or 37 miles southwest of Choteau, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pishkun Reservoir. This includes Highway 287 between mile markers 59 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
